list.name: JavaScript
list.reason: I love JavaScript because it is a versatile language that allows me to build web applications with ease. I have experience with ES6+ features, functional programming, and object-oriented programming.

list.name: TypeScript
list.reason: TypeScript is my go-to language for building scalable and maintainable web applications. I have experience with type annotations, interfaces, inheritance, and generics.

list.name: React.js
list.reason: React.js is my favorite library for building user interfaces. I have experience with hooks, context API, Redux, and React Router.

list.name: Next.js
list.reason: Next.js has been my go-to framework whenever I have to build a web application. I have experience with Server-Side Rendering (SSR) + Static Site Generation (SSG), two features that have given React applications such good improvements in terms of performance and SEO.

list.name: Vue.js
list.reason: Vue.js is another library that I enjoy using for building user interfaces. I have experience with Vue Router, Vuex, Pinia, and Vue CLI.

list.name: Node.js
list.reason: Node.js is my preferred runtime environment for building server-side applications. I have experience with Express.js, RESTful APIs, and GraphQL.

list.name: HTML5
list.reason: HTML5 is the foundation of web development. I have experience with semantic HTML, accessibility, and SEO best practices.

list.name: CSS3
list.reason: CSS3 is essential for styling web applications. I have experience with Flexbox, Grid, animations, and responsive design.

list.name: Tailwind CSS
list.reason: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that I enjoy using for rapid prototyping and building responsive web applications.

list.name: RESTful APIs/GraphQL
list.reason: RESTful APIs are the standard for building web services. GraphQL is an advanced way to fetch data, recommended for complex data structures.
